blurb: Gleam is a statically typed functional programming language for building scalable concurrent systems. It compiles to Erlang and has straightforward interoperability with other BEAM languages such as Erlang, Elixir, and LFE.

key_features.title: Safe
key_features.content: Gleam's powerful static type system helps find and prevent bugs at compile time.

key_features.title: Fault tolerant
key_features.content: The Erlang virtual machine provides well tested mechanisms for gracefully handling failure.

key_features.title: Friendly compiler
key_features.content: Hunting down bugs can be stressful so Gleam's compiler provides clear and helpful feedback.

key_features.title: Friendly community
key_features.content: People of all backgrounds, genders, and experience levels are welcome in the Gleam community.

key_features.title: Erlang compatible
key_features.content: Gleam makes it easy to use code written in other BEAM languages such as Erlang, Elixir and LFE.

key_features.title: Performant
key_features.content: Gleam adds no overhead of its own, so all Gleam programs are as fast as their Erlang counterparts.
